summary: This is an email chain from August 13, 2019, discussing logistical coordination for interviewing victims in the Jeffrey Epstein case (19 Cr. 490). The correspondence involves prosecutors and a victim's attorney arranging a meeting for a victim to speak with prosecutors in New York and inquiring about travel arrangements and counseling resources.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: She is the sender of the initial email, coordinating a meeting for her client (a victim) with prosecutors in New York and requesting information on travel arrangements and counseling resources.

persons.name: Ted Gibbs
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on the initial email from Colleen Mullen regarding victim interview coordination.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on the initial email from Colleen Mullen regarding victim interview coordination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490) for which victim interviews are being coordinated.

connections.description: Mullen is an attorney representing victims who are being interviewed as part of the case against Epstein.
Mullen is communicating with Gibbs (and others) to coordinate victim interviews for the Epstein prosecution.
Mullen is communicating with Fudali (and others) to coordinate victim interviews for the Epstein prosecution.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interview
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for a victim (represented by Colleen Mullen) to speak with prosecutors in New York at 12:00 p.m.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 13, 2019, concerning the coordination of victim interviews for the Jeffrey Epstein prosecution (case 19 Cr. 490).
Attorney Colleen Mullen confirms a victim is available to meet with prosecutors in New York on August 26, 2019, and requests assistance with travel arrangements (flights/hotel).
Mullen also inquires about counseling resources available for the victims she represents.

The email chain includes a logistical question from a prosecutor about the proper legal basis ('what case am I using') to bring witnesses into the Southern District of New York (SDNY) for interviews, highlighting procedural considerations.
